title: This is a call...
body:
Dear Springfield readers,

If you've been keeping silent about the Moxie up until now, do so no longer. It's time to start spreading the word - get a good street-level buzz going. Go climb on top of the nearest roof and/or tree and yell it from there. Shake hands with the person beside you (unless, of course, you're reading this in a public restroom) and let them know where you'll be seeing great independent film in 2005. Let the Moxie ring from the Home Depot on the South side to the Lowes on the North side, from Justice Jewelers in the East to Paradise Adult Superstore in the West. Make every cashew chicken joint jittery with excitement and anticipation for the Moxie's coming. We can do this!

Go team Springfield, GO!

Sincerely,
Dan

PS - for all you non-Springfieldians, keep doing what you're doing... but with more MOXIE!
author: Dan

comments.author: Dave Adams
comments.body: This is why I want that gray t-shirt!

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Dave: when I get back from lunch, I'll see what I can do about getting you a gray Moxie shirt.

comments.author: Aaron
comments.body:
Wait, who else is on team Springfield?

This will most likely run in this week's SBJ. I have a space for it on page 9.

comments.author: Nicole
comments.body: Will you send us any articles, Aaron?

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: All Springfieldians are on team Springfield, Aaron. You're just the most prolific of them.

comments.author: Aaron
comments.body: Yes. I can even offer you a four week trial subscription!

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: I don't think we'll need the trial subscription. Nicole's dad is a subscriber and he saves them for us. Thanks for the offer though!

comments.author: einahpets
comments.body: Springfield township is the township right next to mine in Ohio. I'll go and shout out the news to them.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Most excellent.

comments.author: whitty
comments.body:
Hey, I am prolific.  

And I didn't know we were supposed to be keeping mum about the Moxie.  Um, I've been telling everyone I know.  Admittedly, that really isn't alot of people.  Now I shall continue to do so but with more gusto... or moxie, whichever.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Whitty: Yes, you are prolific. Aaron's just been around a lot longer. Your support is much appreciated!

comments.author: whitty
comments.body: Well, I was thinking prolific as in like abundant.  All the fellas say, 'that whitty sure is abundant.'  Okay, I am rambling and obviously avoiding work so I will finish this worthless comment with: YAY for the Moxie!

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: And YAY for Whitty!

comments.author: Dave Adams
comments.body: I'm just teasing you, Dan.  Don't make a special effort for my hue needs.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: That's a good thing, Dave, b/c CafePress didn't have any gray shirts. Those bastards!

comments.author: whittler
comments.body: Hey Dan, which Springfield is it (what state?)? I'm a bit of an atlas-head.

comments.author: nathan springer
comments.body: hey dan i am a student at sms and i was want to do my final story in my journalism class about the moxie, if there is any way i could get some more info from you write me an e-mail with some kind of contact info. if it is good enough it will be published in the student paper or the news leader, thanks.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body:
Whittler: Springfield, Missouri. Home of Brad Pitt, Cashew Chicken, and the Simpsons.

Nathan: Check your e-mail.

comments.author: Oz
comments.body: I'm doing what I'm doing.  I feel so left out.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Don't feel left out, Oz. You're still my number one commenter!

comments.author: Lor
comments.body: Alas, I am too far away from Springfield to shout about it. I'm pretty sure I could set up some form of large megaphone to spread the word, but it might take me a while to organise.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Do what you can, Lor.

comments.author: Nicholas
comments.body: Congrats all! Your info is now onlinein a press release at missourifilm.com so everyone in the Film Alliance can get excited.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Thanks Nick! I was looking all over for that link...
